title: Cyber_Alien
author: Cyber_Alien
content: I was fortunate enough to learn about Bitcoin before it became so popular. Similarly, I'm one of the idiots who saw this as a huge opportunity to make money, didn't think twice about it, and let it pass them by.Back in 2014, I started my first full-time job online on Fiverr, and I had a couple of friends who were passionate about Blockchain and Bitcoin. It didn't take long for me to make a friend named Michael. We talked a lot about programming and new technology like IoT and AI most of the time. We used to play video games together most of the time when I visited him.One day, after finishing the game, I took his phone to call my girlfriend, and then I noticed something on his phone. It appears to be1BvBMSEZstWetqSFy5Au4m4GFg7xJaHVG6. I noticed that he wanted to send it to someone. I was like, what kind of nonsense is this? He said it wasn't gibberish, then he explained everything I needed to know about Bitcoin addresses and blockchains, and his enthusiasm for the subject captivated my attention so much that I didn't want him to stop talking. But then I recall most of the Ponzi schemes that I fell prey to in the past. The more he talked about it, the more Bitcoin appeared to be the better option for me. It was worth a shot.One of the biggest issues I had that year, and it was the worst year of my life, was that I was very poor, and I didn't have extra money to gamble on something I don't know about. As a result, I concluded that I can't gambling on this.I'm furious at myself for not purchasing bitcoin sooner. Though I'm a happy man now because I can now smile at my wallet.Invest now, so you will not regret it later.

comments.author: Chrlie95
comments.body: I totally agree with you, my friend. Never do the things you will regret and if you do, never regret. I understand where you're coming from with the hesitation to invest in Bitcoin back then. BTC had a bad reputation and the association with the "dark web" and Ponzi schemes made it hard to trust. But as we both know now, it's a real digital currency with huge potential to replace fiat currencies in the future. It's true that there may be "lost trains" when it comes to Ponzi schemes, but a good project like Bitcoin is always a good investment. It's never too late to start investing and we should never regret not starting sooner.

comments.author: pixie85
comments.body: You knew about bitcoin since 2014, went through 2 bull and 3 bear markets and never cared to come to the biggest bitcoin forum on the planet? Better late than never! I usually don't tell people to buy now or regret, I'd rather make them consider all the pros and cons of owning a bitcoin. Once you think about it for a while you'll come to a conclusion that there's a lot of pros, so many you  could make a list, but only 1 significant con (not being able to turn your coins back into fiat without a loss if after you've bought btc enters the bear market).

comments.author: romero121
comments.body: Many people feel that they have missed the opportunity or they're late into the market. Very few get opportunity to enter the market at the right time. We recently reached down to $17k and now we've bounced back. Taking it a chance entering the market is quite good than regret of missing chances in the future when people who entered the market right now enjoying financial growth.Market is always subject to fluctuation and there is always bullish and bearish movement. We need to have a choose the entry point or else we need to invest regularly unlike the price as we were able to invest on the smallest denomination.

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: We just cannot blame those who are having hesitations of investing in this industry. It is a risky investment in the firstplace because of the market price volatility. Not all people are going through same circumstances; some could really afford losing from market price downfalls but most are not. We also have different investment capabilities concerning capital. What's best for those who are planning is to invest first on the knowledge to avoid getting too dragged into hopes of being rich from this industry. That would also help them to know where would they start and focus in this industry. Also, there's no such thing as late; the best time to invest is when you are financially and mentally stable. So be patient for yourself as well.

It doesn't mean that you'll invest in bitcoin, and now you are expecting big profits since most newbies, when they read that kind of message or post, will jump to the conclusion that they will gain easy profit, but it turns out the way is very hard, there are a lot of ups and downs, and we just thought that it was always green.
